We really strive to excel in customer service so thank you for taking the time to write a review, we appreciate the feedback! We look forward to your next stay with us! Amanda Burgess, General Manager

Summary Heading: Quaint and Convenient to the Beach
Summary: This complex is right across the Coast Highway from the beach. The beach is more for viewing. Not recommended for swimming. There are nicer swimming beaches close by within walking distance. There are fire pits on the beach as well as places to fish. There is a raised platform to cross over the highway. No need to worry about cars. There is a train track (also cross-able using the raised platform) that Amtrak uses. There were many trains but they did not cause much noise. We had a one bedroom unit. It was well appointed. Had everything we needed. There was also a gas grill on the balcony. There are units that face the beach and others that look at a hillside. You can call one month in advance and request beachfront rooms. The complex had a nice hot tub and pool. There were also
Manager Response: I'm so glad you enjoyed your stay with us! The staff HAS been here for years and we love what we do. Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review, we appreciate your feedback! We look forward to your next visit! Amanda Burgess, General Manager

Summary: Spent a week at The Surfside inn in Capistrano Beach CA, We had a huge 2 bedroom unit with 2 baths. The unit was nice and had a patio with it's own BBQ. The view was not all that good as it over looked a Mexican Restaurant parking lot. If you leaned out you could see the ocean, Just not from inside the unit.  The staff was friendly and helpful. The Kitchen was well stocked but the appliances are dated but worked well. It had a huge 2 person spa tub, that we did not use as the sewer backed up into it several times while we were there.  The spa outside was nice it was clean and not to hot. The pool area is small but nice about the right size for the amount of units. Parking is at a premium here just enough spots for the units no doubles. If you have a large car or pickup truck the
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the feedback. I appreciate you taking the time to both review us and to point out a few things that may need our attention. I hope you think of us again if you are in the area ;0) -Amanda

Summary: We stayed a week at the Capistrano Surfside Inn and the place was very nice. We had a one bedroom unit overlooking the ocean with a nice balcony looking out at the ocean. The staff was very nice and the everything there was great. They have a nice jacuzzi and pool . There is a covered parking garage. We ate at the two restaurants next door and both were excellent. We will definitely try to return to this place.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to review us! We really appreciate the kind words. We hope you come to stay with us again next time you are in the area ;0)

Summary: Perfect place to relax and enjoy the ocean. Located near shopping, ocean activities, beach, and local sites.  The staff are awesome and all of your needs are meet.  Double jacuzzi tub makes for a romantic night.  Dishes, cooking utensils, dish soap, towels and pool towels are provided.  You can purchase food and grill out every night.  Perfect vacation.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to post a review. We appreciate the kind words. We hope you are able to come stay with us again in the future.

Summary: We did rci timeshare exchange to stay here in February. The manager Amanda was very helpful in facilitating our stay! She arranged for us to upgrade to two bedroom unit when our party expanded from 2 to 6. We were in unit 216 with large covered deck and great view of ocean and beach. Not all units have ocean view ask staff before coming. Excellent room sizes. Bed in master bedroom was very comfortable. Good kitchen for preparing snacks or a meal. Staff very helpful and hospitable.This inn is well maintained and clean. It is on Pacific Coast hwy 1 so much car traffic and trains. There is pool and hot tub which were closed for winter. Shopping is nearby including a costco. Free use of bikes and beach equipment a nice benefit. There is walkway from inn to beach, over the highway.
Manager Response: We are so glad you enjoyed your stay with us! It's our pleasure to accommodate any special requests that we can. Our pool was closed only because it was resurfaced recently (something we have to do every 10 years). Normally it's open year-round. Thanks for the kind words and we hope to see you again in the future!

Summary: We are owners here. It is a timeshare, but they also rent out rooms when they are available. The staff is so nice, especially Augustina.  She is so helpful and kind. Definitely worth a stay if they have vacancies .
Manager Response: We love our owners! Isn't it great to own in paradise? Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review. And I will pass on your comments to Agustina, she is a gem and we are so blessed to have her. We look forward to seeing you next year!  Amanda Burgess, General Manager

Summary: Capistrano Surfside Inn is a super place just steps to the beach. It is located right under the pedestrian walkway to Capistrano Beach and just minutes to the town of San Juan Capistrano. Our room (on the end) was spacious and comfortable with views of the beach. Even though the train and PCH are right in our front yard, there was no problem with noise. You should know the beach is uncrowded for a reason... the sand here is very gravely and not soft. One plus, though, are the fire rings for evening bonfires at the beach.
Manager Response: none

Summary: By the rail road, highway 1, ugly pedestrian overpass for the view. The place is like a retirement housing minus bingo nights. There is a rusty pedestrian overpass that is an eye sore and obscures the beautiful ocean scenery. The whole place smells old and musty.
Manager Response: Guest did not call in advance for a room assignment and the only ocean-view unit left was the handicap unit. She was very upset about having to take the handicap unit.

Summary: This resort is centrally located between LA, Disneyland and San Diego. Easy access to Interstate. Unit very nice, well equipped. Hotel is clean, lots of amenities. They loan beach chairs and bicycles. They gave out lots of information for things to do and shopping. Kitchen well equipped, BBQ on deck. Large shower/Jacuzzi tub. Games room and gym.  Lots of restaurants and shopping within minutes. 1/2 hour on interstate to all attractions. 1/2 hour to John Wayne airport. Scenic Coastal Highway runs in front of hotel. Minutes to Dana Point and San Clemente. Would recommend this hotel and would stay again. Very friendly and helpful staff.
Manager Response: none

Summary: just passt the street and the ocean is there, try to get an ocean view suite and you get a nice balcony and oceanic relax! big rooms (appartments!) fully equipped, big jacuzzi (a bit dated but in good conditions)', 70' s styles furnitures but felt like home! would definetly come back
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Another great stay at Capistrano Surfside Inn!
Summary: Just spent an evening at the Capistrano Surfside Inn and have nothing but compliments! Although our unit was not oceanfront, we enjoyed the quietness of being in the back of the resort. The rooms have been upgraded and have a great local beach vibe! The staff is courteous and always does what they can to ensure a great stay for their guests! I love having a full kitchen with all of the amenities and the shower/tub is HUGE! Would definitely go back and would recommend to others for a nice getaway across the street from the beach!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were at the Surfside in this past week.  We timeshare swapped into a 2 bedroom 1 bath unit.  Full kitchen (small) plus living room, dining area.  Even a view of the beach.  There is an walkway overpass to the beach (it goes over the Pacific Coast Highway and the Amtrak trainline).  The rooms were pretty comfortable although a bit small.  Actually the 'master' bedroom probably would have been better with a queen size bed than a king size bed so that there would be room for end tables on both sides.  The bathroom was very nice -- included a jacuzzi style bathtub.  Staff was very nice.  We'd go back again -- though I don't know that we'd go for a full week, it does make a nice getaway though.  Oh, and though some others have complained about the night noise from the train - we

Summary: What a nice place!  Check in and out was easy. Full kitchens and each unit has a BBQ. We had a great view off the deck of the ocean and a,axing sunsets,  get an ocean view room. There are bicycles that you may borrow and go on nice bike rides along the boardwalk or to Dana Point Harbor.
Manager Response: Thanks for the kind words! And we love your advise to others to call ahead for an ocean-view room! We are a timeshare property so our owners can call 3 months in advance for their room assignment. Our exchange guests can call 1 month in advance. And renters will know at the time of booking what kind of view they will have. We are so glad you enjoyed your stay! Please come back and see us again. -Amanda Burgess, General Manager

Summary Heading: Lovely older resort, great location, wonderful staff!
Summary: This resort is older, but is clean, in a fabulous location, and the staff is absolutely wonderful.  I went with a family member who is a head injury survivor, and has some difficulty understanding complex ideas.  The staff were kind, gracious, patient, and really sweet.  This made my vacation so enjoyable, and if they read this, THANK YOU AGAIN!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed the 1st week of July, 2012. Our 1 bedroom overlooked the ocean, we watched the 4th of July fireworks from our balcony. The furniture was  very comfortable, and clean.  The rooms were nicely decorated.  We cooked,  using the BBQ and other appliances furnished for a terrific home cooked meal.  We had two flat screen TV's, making the grandson very happy as he could hook up his X-box.  We used the pool and jacuzzi which were also well maintained.  Checked out bicycles and rode for miles, enjoying the ride, scenery and shopping.   The staff answered all questions, and were very friendly.  Parking can be a hassle in beach communities.  No problem here,  each guest is issued a pass for their underground parking garage.  There is an elevator and plenty of carts making it easy
Manager Response: none

Summary: Everything was average. There weren't any problems and we had a good time. Definitely go to the Monday morning meeting for some good info about area attractions. We ended up getting 2 for 1 whale watching the same day. Take out the free bikes to get a look at the beach and harbor nearby. The beach directly in front of the place is no good for swimming or surfing. You need to go down to the main beach by the harbor. One bad thing is the commuter train that comes by a couple times an hour it seems like. It's loud but quick.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I am an original owner(since1980's). I own the largest plan, 2BR 2BA  End unit. A little known secret is that the 2BR 2BA end units on the San Clemente side are larger & more quiet than the units facing the mexican restaurant. Both bedrooms are HUGE, as is the spa tub in master BR. Large balcony off LR  & MBR w/BBQ & table/4 chairs. Ceiling fans in BRs, 2 flat screen TVs. Free use of bikes & beach chairs/sand toys. You can catch the train to Anaheim for Disneyland, Angels baseball & Ducks hockey games or to San Diego for the Zoo, Chargers football or Padres baseball games from San Clemente or San Juan Capistrano train stations nearby. Whale & dolphin watching boats, jet skis, standup & regular paddle boards, kayaks, motor scooters, electric bikes & surreys are for rent in Dana
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great service from Agustina and her staff!! A typical hotel does not have a full kitchen with all the hardware that's required to create a meal. You even get a grill in your patio, with the outdoor table in order to enjoy that sea breeze. Which is a great money saver when your on a tight budget that does not allow you to eat out every time. Will go back again in a heart beat.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We are owners here, and this is my favorite week out of every year.  I love the location right across from the beach, but it's also an easy drive to Anaheim, Legoland, and San Diego.  We have great service every time we are there, and I hate leaving to go home.  They make simple upgrades to the property every year to keep it nice, and it is a well-managed property.  We also own a timeshare elsewhere that we convert to points, so we stay at many places around the country, and this one never gets old because of the home-y feel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I loved it this place!  A lot bigger than what you would get in a hotel room.  Pretty much like a one-bedroom apartment.  Loved having the kitchen and even had some friends over for a BBQ!  Nice size deck.  Having the beach across the way was heavenly.  Staff was super friendly and helpful.  I had a chance to enjoy the pool which was nice too.  I didn't really want to leave.  A few pubs and restaurants within walking distance which was so nice.  I would definitely stay here again in a heartbeat and recommend to friends.  Very reasonable too!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: We Love CSI So Much, We Bought Another Week!!!
Summary: We purchased a Sundowner week here around 7 years ago.  The Sundowner units are 2BR/1BA and all face the ocean on the corners of the building.  We live in Alaska so it took a while before we could go down, so in 2008 we stayed for 2 weeks, and it was FANTASTIC!!  We have been timeshare owners for over 10 years and have stayed in places all over the country, but this is our favorite!  The staff is so friendly and efficient, we feel like it is our home away from home.  We love it and bought another week this last winter, Sea Captain, 2BR, 2BA and are looking forward to staying there this coming November. Summary: My husband and I purchased a timeshare at the Capistrano Surfside Inn last year.  We love it.  It's clean, cozy and feels like home.  The staff is friendly and the ammenities are very well kept.  It's a great place to stay, especially if you live Inland, it's close by but yet you feel like you're really getting away from it all.  Great restaurants in all the surrounding areas as well.

Summary: We enjoyed this perfect location, walk on the bridge over the Pacific Coast Highway and right onto the beach... It is close to town, shops and many sights... We didn't get to use the pool but we saw that lots of people were using it. We really took advantage of the bikes to see the local area. Summary: This was one of my favorite places to stay!! We just got back and the service was excellent! The pool was heated and pleasant to swim in even on an overcast day and they have plenty of beach equipment and bikes to check out and use. I hope to visit again soon!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We just returned from spending the week between Christmas and New Year's at the Capistrano Surfside Inn.  The resort is in an outstanding location on the PCH with an overhead crosswalk to Doheny Beach out the front parking lot of the resort. I thoroughly enjoyed a daily morning run overlooking the ocean and the Dana Point harbor.  We stayed in a one bedroom unit that appeared to have been recently updated.  We were on the back side of the resort and did not mind not having an ocean view as things were very quiet and peaceful.  The room had everything we needed, and the giant jacuzzi tub was a plus. Summary: We booked the Week of Christmas 2010, but because of the heavy rains we checked in on Wednesday instead of Sunday.  We stayed thru the day after Christmas and had wonderful weather!  Our one bedroom room had plenty of room and also had a jacuzzi tub in the bathroom!  The amenities were nice - but this is definately an outdoor type of resort.  We were on the first floor with an ocean view.  We did not hear any of our neigbors and the train did not bother us at all.   There is plenty of places to walk and if you take the beach cruisers out - there is plenty of places to ride them to!!  I would definalty book this resort again!

Very spacious and beds comfortable.  Trains that run across street not really a problem as far as noise.  Rained during our week but cleared enough so we could enjoy many outside restaurants.  A Gold Crown and earned it.

Summary Heading: Great stay! Would definitely go back!

The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed the free bike rentals and Wi-Fi. The rooms are nicely decorated and being right next to the beach is fabulous! The only downside is being right next to the train tracks, but the noise wasn't actually that bad. There's a nice little bar (Sunsets) within walking distance for watching the sunset. Overall, it's a great little resort that we strongly recommend!

We asked for a crib 2 weeks prior to arrival and were told that it was in our room; it wasn't.  The room itself was adequate and the front desk staff was pleasant and helpful but the actual timeshare was just "worn"  The location is great as it is directly across the highway from the beach and parking at the timeshare is a breeze but if you are looking for luxury, look elsewhere.

I've been to Hawaii, and a lounge chair will cost you $10.00 a day! At Surfside Inn, they are free. The room is roomy and comfortable,amenities are there if you want to cook or barbecue in the balcony,looking over the nice view of the ocean. The bridge to cross over to go to the beach is just right in front of this hotel,this is one great point to remember,because other hotels nearby are using the same bridge so they have to walk a little. There is also one nice Mexican restaurant next to this hotel.

Summary: We just spent a week at the surfside inn and had a great time. We exchanged through RCI and were really impressed with the quality amenities of the resort.  It's not as fancy as some of the resorts we've been to in the past, but it makes up for it in the friendliness of the staff and the some of the nice touches. For example they have beach chairs, beach toys, pool toys, games, books, bikes, and videos for the guests to "borrow". Every other resort I've been to will rent you these things, if they offer them at all.  We also enjoyed the lack of time-share salespeople trying to sell us a time-share. We hope to go back again.

Summary: My wife and I have stayed for the Sunday to Sunday visit almost every year.  I take my vacation starting the Labor Day weekend to get out of the hot desert for a couple of weeks and enjoy the cool ocean.  The Surfside Inn is a nice 3 story hotel/vacation time-share.  As mentioned, the hotel has full ocean or non-ocean views.  The resort sits at the base of the Capistrano Cliffs so non-ocean rooms do face these bluffs. All rooms have a nice balcony with patio table and chairs.  All have natural gas BBQ's.  We are "owners" of a one bedroom so I cannot verify inventory in 2 bedroom units.  Units have a nice fully stocked (not food) kitchen, which includes stove & oven, fridge, cabinet mounted microwave oven, automatic dishwasher and all necessary cooking utensils and service ware.
